work.name: Numen Capital
work.summary: Worked on the in-house Knowsis research team, leveraging NLP and machine learning for alternative data insights. (1) Developed NLP pipelines for alternative data insights, including ESG tweet classifier based on transformer architecture (97% accuracy), rule-based sentiment analyser, and domain-specific dictionary. (2) Analysed alternative data signals derived from NLP pipelines using time series models. This analysis led to accurate forecasts of market movements, directly assisting quantitative investment strategies.

work.summary: socius is an independent research lab endorsed by the London School of Economics and Political Science. The lab is rooted in social science principles, believing that AI development and deployment must be guided by robust theories and philosophies. We create tools and frameworks that both technical and social science researchers can confidently use and interpret.

publications.name: sentibank: A Unified Resource of Sentiment Lexicons and Dictionaries
publications.publisher: International AAAI Conference on Web and Social Media
publications.summary: Sentiment analysis is critical across computational social science domains, but faces challenges in interpretability. Rule-based methods relying on expert lexicons enable transparency, yet applying them is hindered by resource fragmentation and lack of validation. This paper introduces sentibank, a large-scale unified database consolidating 15 original sentiment dictionaries and 43 preprocessed dictionaries, spanning 7 genres and 6 domains.
